sanskrit_verse: ओघवाताहृतं बीजं यस्य क्षेत्रे प्ररोहति । क्षेत्रिकस्यैव तद्बीजं  न वप्ता लभते फलम् ॥ ९.५४॥ न बीजी लभते फलम्
transliteration: oghavātāhṛtaṃ bījaṃ yasya kṣetre prarohati | kṣetrikasyaiva tad bījaṃ na vaptā labhate phalam || 9.54 || na bījī labhate phalam
sph_interpretive_translation: When a seed displaced by flood or wind germinates in another's field, that seed belongs exclusively to the owner of the field; neither the sower nor the original seed-owner gains the fruit.
jurisprudential_principles: Causation is determined by locus of manifestation
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with control over conditions
Restoration logic prioritizes rightful ownership based on nurturing context
Consciousness alignment requires recognition of active stewardship
executable_legal_axioms: IF seed_origin ≠ field_owner AND growth_occurs(field) THEN fruit_rights(field_owner) = TRUE
IF seed_displaced_by(natural_force) AND planted_in(field) THEN benefit_recipient(field_owner)
IF ownership_claim ≠ locus_of_nurture THEN claim_status = invalid
supreme_court_application: In disputes involving unintended cultivation due to natural forces, the Supreme Court shall recognize domain sovereignty as the primary determinant of entitlement. The threshold of responsibility lies not with intent but with the capacity to nurture and sustain manifestation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that causality flows through the locus of sustained manifestation. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals the sequential emergence of result within the field-owner's domain. Responsibility is proportional to the capacity to support outcome. No punitive action arises—only realignment to factual causality.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion process: Transfer all benefits to rightful field-owner
Responsibility assumption protocol: Acknowledge domain-based causality
Capacity restoration: Ensure both parties retain access to future planting rights
Integrity reintegration: Formalize understanding of stewardship-based ownership
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. Ownership aligns with the field of manifestation. Fruit follows nurture, not origin. Justice restores clarity, not blame. Consciousness is the ultimate arbiter.
